title: Unleashing Open Innovation potential in Living Labs by Enterprise Interoperability and Collaboration Services: the COIN project
segmentation: For those of you who don't know me, my name is Sergio Guzman Ali.
I'm the technical coordinator of the Coin Integrated project.
Who?
So dumb doesn't make you laugh.
So my presentation will be more or less structured in three main path one I will give a.
Short overview of the Coin Integrated project and what are the paths of the coin which are more related to open innovation issues?
Then I will present the notion of business ecosystem inside the coin.
Business ecosystem is a concept which is quite related.
Also to live in labs indeed.
And then I will just sketch some collaboration ideas which probably will be better defined and better discussed during the discussion afterwards.
So a coin A is an integrated project is funded in FP7.

Call one objective 123 ICT for networked enterprises and the main aim of the coin project is to develop enterprise interoperability and enterprise collaboration services which should be provided to enterprises and two semis in particular as utility that is.
The concept here is that we have utility services and value added services.
So far collaboration and interoperability services are mixed up with value added services.

The basic idea of coin is to try to extract the collaboration and the interoperability part out of the value added services and to put them in a specialized platform which will provide such services as utility.
That is, as a commodity under new business models, and this is the main objective of the coin.
Greater project.
Calling Integrated Project started last year in January and it will last, hopefully for years.
It is.
A large project 21 partners coming from industry coming from academia and research and coming from industry from the end user site.
Our reference model is the final model that is in the FP 6, so we had several several projects addressing interoperability and collaboration.
The point is that for cold one ICT.
Somebody decided that just one IP should be funded in this in this environment, and so we had to collect and to consider results and outcomes coming from several other different projects in FP 6.
So we could say that although formally the coin IP is a project of 21 partners, the concept it is that it is an open project.
That is, everybody could join us and everybody could give contribution to the coin.
So briefly, the coin has five main chapters of research.
One is enterprise interoperability, and for those of you who attended yesterday and the day before workshop, so we spoke Monday about science based for enterprise interoperability.
Yesterday we spoke about business cases for enterprise interoperability.
So what is?
The the value proposition of enterprise interoperability solution providers to the industry to the enterprises.
Second part is enterprise collaboration and today I will focus more on enterprise collaboration.
Then there is a part of which is related to the concept of global service delivery platform and future Internet, which is very very technical.
And again I will not address this today and it is how the services will be provided to enterprises.
Dana, there is one part which is related to business models value proposition for implementing the software as a service as utility.
The sassy oh business model, which is what I explained before.
So how to make enterprise interoperability and enterprise collaboration services, commodities and utilities for enterprises and not mixed up with the value added services with a solution of.
Private software vendors.
Independent software vendors.
And then we will see how currently the coin is spent, that is, to what market such a coin is spendor.
And we have a 6 enterprise networks which will be our main pilot.
But again the coin project is not.
It's an open project, so we are open to accept other pilots other experimentations.
Just briefly, what we have in mind as far as the coin architecture, we are aware that we studied and we researched a lot.
In the field of enterprise collaborative platforms, that is, platforms which allow enterprises to collaborate and remain enterprise collaboration, but also human collaboration.
And in Coyner we are addressing three different kinds of collaboration.
Hierarchical collaboration in supply chains.
Say me hierarchical collaboration, where you have a service center which is able to coordinate the activities of the enterprises and of the Smas.
And the business ecosystem idea.
The business ecosystem idea is not hierarchical collaboration form among enterprises and among people.
But we will discuss it.
Afterwards.
On the other side of the wall, so you know there is a usual.
Debate about business and it.
That is how to make business implemented in it and how to make it comprehensible by business people.
This is more or less So what coin is is addressing.
So we have the business part and we have the IT part that part in Coiner is made of the so called Internet of Services.
Internet of Services is a view of the future Internet.
And in this view we have two main extreme position on the one side we have a very specialized service, parks, very specialized service clouds.
That is big large IT solution providers.
They will concentrate services on very specialized datacenters, application centers and enterprises will outsource completely.
There it or completely or partially their it to such specialized data and application centers.
This is software as a service and it is cloud computing as well.
So cloud computing is away for IT professional to efficiently and effectively manage their data center and their application centers.
On the other extreme side, you have a Galaxy, a Galaxy of services of billions of services.
There is a vision of 1 integrated project which is SOA for all.
Which say that future Internet, the Internet or services will be made of billions billions of services which will be also user generated.
So another important characteristic is that user generated services.
That these services, which are generated not by ID professionals, not by IT experts but by users.
And in between of them.
We have the coin, the coin platform, so the coin platform is something which is.
In between the extreme specialization of IT professionals in cloud computing, in service pack and the user generated services, the Galaxy of user generated services.

So for instance, the service level agreements are very well defined and very well specified in this part are in the IT professional, but they are not reliable and most of the case is not available in the Galaxy in the constellation of billions of services.
This is what the coin is mainly addressing, and we are addressing in enterprise interoperability and enterprise collaboration domain.
Or one part of one side of the coin is enterprise collaboration.
For coin we started from the Echo, Ditto.
From the Eco Leader integrator project and from the digital business Ecosystem Integrated Project, what is the main idea of equality?
The main idea of equally is that.
There is a a short window of opportunity.
Between a business opportunity is published in the market and the formation of a virtual organization to match and to try to satisfy this business opportunity.
This very short window of opportunity is the main cause for enterprises and mainly for Smas.
Not to be able to respond to such business opportunity.
So how to do what to do they equal leader?

We developed a so-called breeding environment and breeding environment is a long term alliance aggregation of enterprises and SMS and the main purpose of this long term alliance is to get enterprises and the same, in particular to get them prepared.

Two collaboration which means that to eliminate the organizational, the technological, the conceptual, the business barriers which or to try to eliminate them, which will prevent enterprises from forming in a short window.
Veto organizations.
This is the major outcome of the equity.
And the.
In equally we separated very clearly.
Enterprise networks from networks of individuals.
This was done in separate work packages and we developed separate methodologies and we developed separate tools also to support enterprise collaboration and human collaboration.
This is what?
It's.
We got from the eco lead and then in coin we are aiming to develop a collaboration space in which we have.
Enterprise collaboration and human collaboration mixed together and contribute to the benefit of the collaboration to the benefit of the collaborative Network.
Inside the coin.
We are also aiming at developing methodologies and tools to allow the generation of business opportunities from inside the network.
So in equilibrium there is an extra services to the King stop.
In coiner we have a very different approach.
First of all we aim at having an environment where business opportunities could be generated from inside the network.
That is, the networks which know each other which meet regularly.
They could find business opportunities among them without waiting from an external customer asking for a service, asking for a product.
Second, as soon as we have an external customer asking for a service or for the product, the philosophy of coin is to keep the customer involved.
Keep the customer involved in every stage of the vilt organization, preparation, creation, management, operation and dissolution.
We are supporting this in three different scenarios.
One is new product development, the other one is production planning and the third one is project Management and Alberto afterwards will mainly focus on product design, new product development.
We will enable cooperativity of enterprise applications, that is, enterprise applications, which will be used not just by individuals or by group of users, but also by communities.
That is how to make enterprise applications useful and user friendly for groups of users and for communities.
We will support Web to that or participative principles, and we will follow the whole lifecycle of virtual organization.
And.
The final aim will be to create an innovation knowledge ecosystem that is an environment where we have companies.
Large companies, SME is.
We have research centers, universities and we have individual professionals, raiteri consultants, teenagers, so the so called.
Digital natives, so people who.
Are born in the digital era and so they are very, very good with the technology and with the new IT.
So this is more or less what we aim at.
Second pointer is the business model, but I.
Will go very fast.
The business model is a process towards the so called tap model that is from a model where enterprises are.
The myth was plug and play this that is enterprises choose one solution provider ASAP for instance and the myth was to have a plug and play interface to SFP.
But the point is that it was very very difficult to switch.
That is to select another solution providers.
Once you have built all your interfaces to one single vendor offer.
And so this, which is, is another option that is and it is based on open standards, open interfaces and the pointer is.
That enterprises should be able to more or less seamlessly pass from one solution provider to another solution.
Providers without distroying and revolutionizing the IT system.
That app model is.
It's like a mixture of hot and cold water.
And so on.

The basis of the business process higher I have, I'm the enterprises are able to select the best services which are currently present on the market and they're able to orchestrate and compose them on the fly.
This is the vision business vision of of coin that is to allow this this metaphor, that is enterprises to be able to dynamically compose an orchestrate services.
From different.
IT solution providers.
The hour the pilot, the pilot of coin are six, they are divided into.
Business perspective and knowledge perspective and they are divided in the supply chains, collaborative networks, and business ecosystems.
I think that for the workshop of today.
Perhaps we could just.
Mention the business ecosystem part.
We have two business ecosystems.
In our.
In our test cases, and what is a digital business ecosystem?
The definition is from Mr. Morelen 96.
It is an Economic Community supported by foundation of interacting organizations and individuals.
The Organism of the business world.
This Economic Community produce goods and services of value to customers who themselves are members of the ecosystem.

So this is the definition of the ecosystem and it is what I tried to explain just just before the point we had first implementation of the digital business ecosystem in the DB integrated project where they.
They found a strict relation between the business ecosystem and the digital ecosystem, and they developped a peer to peer environment.
For that.
The coiner the coin proposal is a bit is a bit different.
Also be cause the DB is started at the beginning of FP 6, so it started together with a colleague started together with Latina and so they use the technologies.
Which are now five years old, so they didn't know web to that or they didn't know.
Collective intelligence.
Dissipative issues and so on.
Employee ID is one of our business ecosystem.
It is an engineering company which is specialized in designing Mills designing meals for the wood, wood and paper, wood and paper industry.
And.
When you are going to design A meal in a certain territory, you cannot make just an engineering.
Project you should also involve the local authority.
Should also involve the people the citizens are.
You should also involve the municipalities which will be involved and so you will have an impact.
Environmental social impact, which is relevant to this to this ecosystem.
This is what we aim to study in this in this business ecosystem that is not to have just.
In services for individual engineers services for a team of engineers, but to have also services which will include also all the community.
All the community which is affected by a high impact.
An important project like build.
In a new meal.
Another case is a completely different.
It is located in UK.
And it is about social social services.
This map shows that.
In the same region of England you have for the man.
A life expectancy which is 1215 years less in the red zones rather than in the blue in the blue zones in the blue areas.
The red zones are the most industrialized.
Most crowded areas, but you know there are neighbors.
They are neighbors and you have 12 to 15 years.
Difference in the life expectancy of men?
Then women that I think they will have more.
Yeah, they exist anyway.
Anne Anne so the point is how to improve the condition mainly in this red zones.
That is how to develop social communities and social services which will allow disadvantaged people in the red zones to prolong the expectation to increase their quality of life.
And we are talking here mainly not of.
Patients, but of elderly people which are not patients but which need assistance and social care.
In the coin project we have the.
The Pinocchio, the Pinocchio tale.
That is the coiner is.
Is open to other people who want to contribute to our success of our projects, so we require you to give us.
Some coins, a couple of coins and we are sure we will develop for you a tree, a tree of coin and your coin will be multiplied by our project.
So there are different degrees and this is basically what we propose to the Living Lab community that is to become members of the coin.
Then if they like also to become testimonials of the coin.
It shows and to prepare additional test cases, we called coin multipliers in order to contribute to the success of dissemination and exploitation of coin results.
And the.
And then I think I have two slides for ideas of collaboration.
We will discuss them.
In the following hours.
So what is bringing coin to the Living Lab community?
First of all, calling is an ICT challenge, one project, so it is a technological project mainly, but not exclusively.
So we could provide.
Future Internet technology.
The ICT infrastructure enterprise interoperability, human and enterprise collaboration services for the Living lab.
The first integrated coin system will be available at the end of this of this year, so we could start collaborations just at the end of 2009 and then go on in 2010 with a living lab community.
The mechanism for collaboration will be of course the mechanism of the coin Angel of the coin multipliers, which will start end of 2009.
On the other hand, I see also an opportunity for Living Labs to influence the coin, the coin research.

Edit It will be very, very important to bring the living lab spirit for open innovation into the coin project, which means how to improve the usability and cooperativity of the technical solutions of coin.
How to improve the business models of coin with more participative, citizen centric, user centric approach and how to improve the effectiveness of the testing and validation of the coin pilot.
That is, living Labs could bring to coin their spirit, their methodology's, and I think that coin, technical, business and pilots could benefit a lot from from Living Lab and.
Uh.
A possible offering from Living Lab is to improve the involvement of the end users in the project.
One example could be serious gaming, serious games or whatever.

It's a viewing and evaluating the coin outcomes and participation and organization of joint workshops, joint studies and joint events, and the mechanism we foresee for this collaboration is Coin Angels and Coin Angels are external experts which are in charge to organize such activities and they will.
They will receive a reimbursement for their expensive.
Expenses from on the coin plotted.
